intro: Brachypodium distachyon f. paradoxum, commonly known as the paradoxum form, is a variant of the grass species Brachypodium distachyon. It is characterized by its unique morphological features, including altered growth patterns and distinctive inflorescence structures. This form is often studied for its genetic and developmental differences compared to the standard species. It exhibits traits that make it valuable in research related to plant genetics and evolution. The paradoxum form is also used as a model organism in studies of stress responses and genomic research.
